Event.0: British author Dame Barbara Cartland—who wrote more than 700 books, mostly formulaic novels of romantic love set in the 19th century—died.
Event.1: Indian politician Rajiv Gandhi, who served as the country's prime minister (1984–89), was assassinated in a suicide bombing attack.
Event.2: Reggae musician Bob Marley receives a Jamaican state funeral
Event.3: Michelangelo's Pietà, a sculpture depicting the Virgin Mary supporting the body of the dead Christ, was attacked and badly damaged in St. Peter's Basilica, Vatican City.
Event.4:
Jeffrey Dahmer
American serial killer
was born
Event.5:
Loretta Lynch
American lawyer and official
was born
Event.6:
Al Franken
United States senator
was born
Event.7: Actor Burgess Meredith (36) weds actress Paulette Goddard (33) at David O Selznick's Beverly Hills home
Event.8: After flying for 17 hours from Newfoundland, Amelia Earhart lands near Londonderry, Northern Ireland, becoming the 1st transatlantic solo flight by a woman
Event.9: American aviator Amelia Earhart became the first woman to pilot an airplane solo across the Atlantic Ocean.
Event.10:
First nonstop solo transatlantic flight made by Charles Lindbergh
American aviator Charles A. Lindbergh completed the first nonstop solo flight across the Atlantic Ocean on this day in 1927, traveling from New York to Paris in the monoplane Spirit of Saint Louis in about 33.5 hours.
Event.11: Aviator Charles Lindbergh, in the Spirit of St Louis, lands in Paris after the first solo air crossing of Atlantic
Event.12: Soviet nuclear theoretical physicist and human rights advocate Andrey Sakharov, who won the 1975 Nobel Prize for Peace, was born in Moscow.
Event.13: 1st horror movie (Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde) premieres in Chicago
Event.14:
Fats Waller
American musician
was born
Event.15: Federation Internationale de Football Association (FIFA) forms in Paris
Event.16: Clara Barton founded the American Association of the Red Cross (later the American Red Cross).
Event.17: The Commune of Paris revolted against the French national government under Adolphe Thiers, beginning a period of violence known as “Bloody Week.”
Event.18: -July 28] French regular troops attack Commune of Paris; 17,000 die
Event.19: During the small civil war known as Bleeding Kansas—a dispute over control of the new U.S. territory of Kansas under the doctrine of popular sovereignty—the town of Lawrence was sacked by a pro-slavery mob intent on destroying the “hotbed of abolitionism.”
Event.20: French painter Henri Rousseau—the archetype of the modern naive artist, known for his richly coloured and meticulously detailed pictures of lush jungles, wild beasts, and exotic figures—was born in Laval.
Event.22: Prince Willem FK marries Louise AWA of Prussia
Event.23: Mount Unzen on Japan's Shimabara Peninsula, erupts creating a tsunami, killing about 15,000; Japan's deadliest volcanic eruption
Event.24: Lady Jane Grey (15), later English queen for 9 days, marries Lord Guildford Dudley (18)
Event.25: Spanish explorer and conquistador Hernando de Soto, the first European to discover the Mississippi River, died and was buried in the river in Louisiana.
Event.26:
Philip II
king of Spain and Portugal
was born
